Dear Megan Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at triestramc@michigan.gov.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(4) Only the least restrictive intervention necessary to prevent
immediate harm to the youth or others may be used and must follow
an individualized set of graduated interventions that avoid the use of
restraints.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation 18-year-old Youth does not feel safe with two staff members at
facility due to them hitting her and pushing her to the ground.
Youth does not have injuries currently and is in the psychiatric
hospital.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
06/02/2023.
I interviewed the complainant via telephone on 06/02/2023 and the
reported no further information.
I interviewed Youth A at the Hospital on 06/05/2023. Youth A is 18
years old and has been at the facility for 4 years. Youth A is
currently in the hospital due to self-harming. Youth A reported on
05/22/2023 she attempted to AWOL from the hospital when Vista
Maria Staff 2 and Staff 3 grabbed her by the arm and pushed her
to the floor. She reported the incident to Consumer Rights Officer
when she returned to the facility. Youth A expressed she has been
at the facility for four years and wants to be moved out of the
facility. She said the plan is for her to go to an AFC home, but that
is not what she wants.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Worker on 06/05/2023. She
met with Youth A on 06/01/2023 and Youth A refused to discuss
the incident. She did not observe any marks or bruises on Youth
A. She said Youth A has a history of AWOLing, being sexually
active, and drug use. Due to Youth A’s mental capacity, she is in
the process of finding her an AFC home.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer on 06/16/2023. Consumer
Rights Officer reported there was an incident on 05/22/2023
involving Youth A attempting to AWOL while being discharged
from Children’s Hospital. He said there were 3 staff members with
2

Youth A at the Hospital. Youth A had reported that staff attempted
to restraint her at the hospital, so an internal investigation was
completed on 05/26/2023. He found that Staff 2 and Staff 3
attempted to physically manage Youth A after she attempted to
AWOL from the hospital. He said Staff are not permitted to
physically manage a youth while off campus unless it is a
potentially lifesaving intervention. It was recommended that Staff 2
and 3 be provided additional coaching on appropriate behavioral
interventions and truancy policy. Staff 3 is currently out on
medical leave. Staff 1 and 2 work the midnight shift. Contact
information as provided for Staff 1 and 2.
I interviewed Staff 1 via telephone on 07/06/2023. Staff 1 has been
working at the facility for 3 years and has completed the refresher
course for CPI. She recalled the incident involving Youth A on
05/22/2023. She said Youth A was being discharged from the hospital.
She was walking with Youth A to meet the Staff 2 and 3 at the hospital
entrance door, and that’s when Youth A attempted to AWOL. Staff 2 and
3 attempted to block the door and Staff 3 grabbed Youth A by the arms.
Youth A bit Staff 3’s arm, then kicked and spit on Staff 3. Staff attempted
to restrain Youth A. Staff 2 called for hospital security to assist and the
police were contacted. Youth A was transported to the facility by the
police.
I interviewed Staff 2 via telephone on 07/06/2023. Staff 2 is a team
leader and has been working at the facility for 19 years. He reported on
05/22/2023 he and Staff 3 went to pick up Youth A from Children’s
Hospital. While walking out of the hospital Youth A was resisting and
attempted to AWOL. He contacted the Supervisor and was instructed to
contact the police. He said Staff 3 attempted to stop Youth A from
leaving and Youth A was kicking and biting Staff 3. He said he and Staff
3 attempted to block and stop Youth A from AWOLing, but denied hitting
or pushing Youth A. He said the police were contacted and the police
transported Youth A from the hospital to the facility.
Documents reviewed:
• Facility policy on Hospital Coverage Protocol Staff expected to
adhere to the following expectations while providing hospital
coverage: DO NOT physically manage a client at any point when
in the community.
• Incident report dated 05/22/2023 written by Staff 1. The report is
consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
• Staff 2 and Staff 3 employee files do not have disciplinary
reports.
Analysis The facility is not compliant with the rule as interviews with Staff,
Youth, and documentations indicted that staff grabbed and attempted
to restrain youth who was trying to AWOL from the hospital.
Conclusion Violation Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
